snippet: Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan offered to hold a referendum to decide the fate of the park in central Istanbul that has become the locus of protests against his government.
abstract: Turkey's Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan offers to hold referendum to decide fate of park in central Istanbul that has become locus of protests against his government and presented him with most serious challenge he has faced in his decade in power.

byline.original: By SEBNEM ARSU and CEYLAN YEGINSU
byline.contributor: Tim Arango contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Dan Bilefsky from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan offered to hold a referendum to decide the fate of the park in central Istanbul that has become the locus of protests against his government.

headline.main: Turkish Leader Offers Referendum on Park at Center of Protests
headline.print_headline: Turkish Leader Offers Referendum on Park at Center of Protests

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
